alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 6:23AM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A line of showers with isolated thunder and gusty winds will impact portions of Houston and southeastern Henry Counties in southeastern Alabama, southeastern Clay, eastern Randolph, Lee, Calhoun, Early and northwestern Seminole Counties in southwestern Georgia, northwestern Worth County in south central Georgia, Miller, western Dougherty, northwestern Baker and Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through 815 AM EST/715 AM CST/... At 721 AM EST/621 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking this activity along a line extending from near Dawson to near Cottonwood. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Cottonwood, Morgan, Albany, Blakely, Dawson, Donalsonville, Leesburg, Ashford, Cowarts, Edison, Arlington, Shellman, Columbia, Leary, Smithville, Walker, Douglasville, Centerville and Avon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
